lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Brent Staples's June 23 Editorial Observer, ''The Mississippification of California Schools,'' has much truth in it. However, the problem is far more complex than Proposition 13, a lack of investment and certified teachers. Demographics of students have changed greatly in the last 20 years. Sixty percent of California children speak a language other than English. The fads presented to California teachers have increasingly been at the direction of a state political bureaucracy that changes its preferences with the wind.
abstract: Prof Lawrence Kemper letter disputes Brent Staples's June 23 Editorial Observer column on California's public school system
